11#include "modules/audio_coding/neteq/cross_correlation.h"
12
13#include <cstdlib>
14#include <limits>
15
16#include "common_audio/signal_processing/include/signal_processing_library.h"
17
18namespace webrtc {
19
20// This function decides the overflow-protecting scaling and calls
21// WebRtcSpl_CrossCorrelation.
22int CrossCorrelationWithAutoShift(const int16_t* sequence_1,
23 const int16_t* sequence_2,
24 size_t sequence_1_length,
25 size_t cross_correlation_length,
26 int cross_correlation_step,
27 int32_t* cross_correlation) {
28 // Find the element that has the maximum absolute value of sequence_1 and 2.
29 // Note that these values may be negative.
30 const int16_t max_1 =
31 WebRtcSpl_MaxAbsElementW16(sequence_1, sequence_1_length);
32 const int sequence_2_shift =
33 cross_correlation_step * (static_cast<int>(cross_correlation_length) - 1);
34 const int16_t* sequence_2_start =
35 sequence_2_shift >= 0 ? sequence_2 : sequence_2 + sequence_2_shift;
36 const size_t sequence_2_length =
37 sequence_1_length + std::abs(sequence_2_shift);
38 const int16_t max_2 =
39 WebRtcSpl_MaxAbsElementW16(sequence_2_start, sequence_2_length);
40
41 // In order to avoid overflow when computing the sum we should scale the
42 // samples so that (in_vector_length * max_1 * max_2) will not overflow.
43 const int64_t max_value =
44 abs(max_1 * max_2) * static_cast<int64_t>(sequence_1_length);
45 const int32_t factor = max_value >> 31;
46 const int scaling = factor == 0 ? 0 : 31 - WebRtcSpl_NormW32(factor);
47
48 WebRtcSpl_CrossCorrelation(cross_correlation, sequence_1, sequence_2,
49 sequence_1_length, cross_correlation_length,
50 scaling, cross_correlation_step);
51
52 return scaling;
53}
54
55} // namespace webrtc
56
